newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway shares edge higher pulled by blue chips.
newsitem.headline: Norway shares edge higher pulled by blue chips.

text.p: Norwegian shares edged higher in moderate trade on Friday with blue chips Kvaerner, Norsk Hydro and Aker leading the way.
The Total share index rose 0.4 percent to 842.59 points in turnover of 743 million crowns after a week of little activity.
Kvaerner A was the most traded share at 125 million crowns and rose 0.8 percent to 240 crowns.
Norsk Hydro climbed 0.8 percent to 304.50 crowns. The Aker A share was up 1.5 percent at 134 crowns.
The industrial and banking indexes both rose slightly while the shipping and insurance indexes were flat.
